headline: Scrumptious Salmon Cakes
description: This salmon cakes recipe for homemade patties uses canned salmon mixed with panko, parsley, Worcestershire, and green onion for a quick and easy meal.
name: Scrumptious Salmon Cakes
recipeIngredient: 2 (14.75 ounce) cans salmon, drained and flaked
2 tablespoons creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip¬Æ)
2 teaspoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay¬Æ)
1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together salmon, panko, parsley, eggs, green onions, Worcestershire sauce, Parmesan cheese, Dijon mustard, creamy salad dressing, seafood seasoning, garlic powder, and pepper in a large bowl. Divide mixture and shape into 8 patties.
Heat enough olive oil in a large skillet to cover the cooking surface over medium heat. Fry salmon patties in batches until browned, 5 to 7 minutes per side. Repeat with more olive oil as needed.

review.reviewBody: Wow!!! My husband is EXTREMELY picky when it comes to salmon - much less from a can, but - we had ourselves two cans ‚Äúgifted‚Äù to us and I needed to figure out what to make with them. Found this. Because of my ‚Äúfear,‚Äù halved except used 1/2c panko. One can/halving the recipe resulted in 7 patties for us. Fried in our cast iron. This! Was! AWESOME! Dipped in tartar but would like to make an aioli next time. Husband ate 3 patties! üò≥ They were that good and he was surprised this came from a can! Would absolutely make again! Stellar recipe Judiebug!! Thank you!
Great recipe. I replaced the salmon with chub mackerel and added some jalape√±os. And it was a huge success
Great combination of flavors made as written! Really enjoyed these and will definitely make again.
I follow the recipe exactly. We love it just the way it is.
Fantabulous!!! Cooked in iron skillet on the grill & it was smashing delicious. Haven‚Äôt tried salmon cakes since I was at home some 40 years ago!! Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe!
I made the recipe exactly as written. We enjoyed them. I have a brand new container of ‚Äú old bay‚Äù. It‚Äôs zippier than I remember. The salmon cakes were very flavorful. Thanks
I didn‚Äôt add the full amount of spices called for since a review stated it was pretty spicy. It was very good and I will make it again. The spouse loved it.
Excellent recipe! The folks saying it's too spicy must like their food bland because I made these exactly as recipe directed and they came out so tasty and delicious!
Delicious! Doubled the recipe and used leftover bbq salmon. Not too spicy for us. Recommend this recipe for sure!
added alittle lemon & shredded cheese of your choice, this recipe always gets rave reviews

Followed the recipe as close as possible. I used 10 crushed saltines instead panko. There are only 2 of us so I made half. It made 6 patties and baked in the air fryer at 350 for 10 minutes on one side and 5 on the other. Very good. Served with Heinz Ketchup of course!
Omg these were so good. Don‚Äôt change a thing.
The Best recipe for canned salmon! We love canned salmon patties, especially in the warm months. This is a keeper.
This recipe is hands down the best for this Maryland family, I wouldn't change a thing!!
Very good, added a splash of lemon juice, 1 tsp dill weed, 1 tsp dried onion flakes to mix. Baked at 375 for approx 20 - 25 minutes, turning once.

Too much seasoning. The garlic isn't needed nor the worcestershire sauce.
 overall not pleasant tasting.
Came out really dry, followed directions

I halved the recipe and I got 6 large patties. More than enough for just my husband and I. I also added some saut√©ed minced celery, red bell pepper and onion to the mixture. Served it with a nice salad.
Husband loves salmon cakes, and he really liked this recipe. Even though I halved this dish, still needed two eggs.

This cakes were not great - just ok. Too many extra flavours like parmesan and dijon and too strong doses of worstershire, black pepper and dijon mustard. I like them plainer than this. These tasted overprocessed - we could hardly taste the fish.

My husband & I did not like. I will not add miracle whip, mustard, W sauce, or panko crumbs again. It was too MUSHY.
I did lightly dust the patties in flour, which was its only saving grace.

These were really good - I didn‚Äôt use old bay but had some spicy crab boil seasoning around and that was delicious. I had just a bit of trouble getting them to hold together, but I‚Äôm willing to say it was probably user error. I remember thinking the mixture looked like it needed a tad more Panko - don‚Äôt be reluctant to throw in another spoonful if it doesn‚Äôt look like it‚Äôs holding.
Turned out really good. I left out the Dijon mustard and salad dressing. Patties didn‚Äôt fall apart had a great taste.

Really good will make again! Loved the addition of Worcestershire. 
My mom used to have a white gravy/sauce with peas.
Excellent.

I‚Äôve never made a salmon patty. This recipe was sooo good. I used fresh salmon and chopped it finely, everything else was pretty much as written. The flavors were delicious and balanced. I served it with a sour cream, yogurt lemon sauce. I‚Äôll make these again!
I used left over grilled salmon and substituted the green onions for sweet because that is what I had on hand. It came out great and I will make again!

Thank you, thank you, thank you !!
This recipe was delish and I will forever use yours!!
Perfect balance of flavors.
Highly recommend!!!

All I can say is anyone who loves this recipe does not like salmon. It is far to spicy and one would not know there was any salmon in it. Salmon has a very delicate flavour and does not do well covered in heavy spice. I would not give this even one star.
this is a good recipe, only thing I did differently, was I used fresh salmon.

Made 1/2 the recipe for the 1st time today, pretty much (I think) as per the recipe. I used homemade Old Bay spice and a couple of green onions but otherwise followed as written. Loved the outcome. Very tasty and just the right amount of spice for me. I‚Äôve never had real Old Bay so I can‚Äôt compare but for me it was a tasty balance of flavour and will definitely make again. Thanks for posting!
So good, I made them again 2 days after making them the first time! Definitely going to be a weekday meal! Thank you for sharing this!

Delicious! Formed the salmon cakes in the morning, covered and refrigerated them until dinner time. Took another reader's suggestion and coated them in Panko before frying. We made a tartar sauce to serve with. Easy, elegant, economical, and a definite keeper!!!
Old time recipe from my childhood. I serve it with peas in cream sauce.
I halved the recipe and it made 4 large patties, full of flavour so filling would recommend absolutely
I'll stick to my own recipe. Did not like this.

I didn‚Äôt have panko so I substituted saltines. Everything else was per the recipe. I halved the recipe and got 4 patties. Seriously delicious. I put it on a bun the next day with hot sauce. Dear Lord. Soooooo good.

Delicious. We used leftover grilled salmon and Tony's Creole seasoning because that's what I had on hand, and toned down the amount of that and pepper because my family doesn't like so much kick. Very good!

I tweaked the ingredients a bit as I couldn't find old bay seasoning in my grocery store. I wasn't fussy on the texture of the cakes, but the taste was great. I will probably try this again sometime although I might change it up a bit and use Tuna or Crab instead of the salmon.
Excellent
Excellent! Plenty spicy without the pepper. Will add to my regular rotation!
Very good. I am still having trouble with the cakes falling apart. Any suggestions?

This is a great recipe!!! Rarely do I make a recipe as it is written. The only thing I changed was adding another tablespoon of creamy salad dressing to help hold the cakes together. I‚Äôve made these twice now.
Best salmon patty recipe I‚Äôve come across!
Excellent and tasty recipe! My children and I made It together. Perfect! Thank you
Quite good! mild, tender, and full of flavor. Enjoyed very much. Left out the Dijon - didn't have any.
These are tasty. I think I will use another egg to get the parties to hold together better.
Delicious! I substituted bread crumbs to corn meal and it was good, full of flavor!

I made these salmon cakes today for lunch and they turned out delicious. I used all of the ingredients listed except the green onion which I didn't have on hand. I thought the flavor of the patty was perfectly well balanced . I didn't think it was too spicy but I only eyeballed the red pepper flakes to my taste. I let mine sit in the fridge for a few minutes before cooking. They turned out really crispy and flavorful.
Fantastic
Easy recipe! Just like Mom used to make.

Really liked this recipe. I did tweak it a bit based on what I had available. No onions, subbed Mrs Dash Chipotle seasoning for seafood seasoning. Very flavorful & perfect on a bed of greens or on a bun. I may add diced red pepper next time.
Easy to make. Tasty.

I will surely make it again; only change was that I used my snapper leftover instead of salmon but turned great following all other recommendations! 
After mixing all ingredients I left it in the refrigerator to rest for 30 minutes and it was easier to form the cakes and cook them!
Quick and tasty. Will share the recipe with my friends.
Added a tblspoon of Old Bay Hot Sauce to the mix, along with thin sliced celery (including the leafy green tops) - Excellent recipe!

This has become my favorite way with canned salmon. I halved the recipe and grilled the patties outside using a copper grilling sheet. For an added touch, I added a teaspoon or so of liquid smoke. Delicious!

Delicious and easy. I only had one can of salmon so had to adjust ingredients a bit. No panko so used crumbs I had saved from stale loaf of Italian bread. I made them early in the day and refrigerated for about an hour which I think made them easier to handle. Also rolled in dry bread crumbs before cooking. Like one other reviewer I added a bit of butter to oil to get crispier outside. Had over spaghetti with butter and parmeson cheese. Side dish of watermelon/blueberry salad.

These were my first attempt at Salmon Cakes. I had about 12 oz. of leftover grilled salmon so I used that. I did use about 1/2 the Dijon Mustard, had to substitute red onion for Spring Onion, added a bit more Mayo and garlic powder. I also needed more oil when frying. I served with a quick tarter sauce recipe but added some Franks Red Hot to it. Everything was delicious.
Great! I would omit the Worcestershire sauce and replace with tablespoon of minced capers. I used 3 green onions and may add a bit of minced garlic. Otherwise great recipe!
Came out good
Hubby made these tonight and they are a new favorite!! He used breadcrumbs instead of panko with what we had. So delicious, tons of flavor!

This is a fantastic, well seasoned recipe! I used safflower oil in place of olive oil, due to the neutral flavor and high smoke point. I also reduced the cooking temp a little as I often do when cooking with cast iron.

We just adore this recipe!!! The only changes we made was we substituted 1 1/2 pound of fresh salmon for canned and cut the old bay in half. We have made this for countless friends and they all keep asking for the recipe!

I substituted: regular mayo with a 1/2 tablespoon of honey, lemon pepper seasoning and 1 packet of Goya in lieu of seafood seasoning, 1 ounce of Colby jack cheese. This was FANTASTIC! I'm definitely adding it to my favorite recipes box.

Yum! Used mayo instead of miracle whip, spicy brown mustard instead of Dijon and added a few black beans to it. I used what I had to use up already cooked left over salmon that I didn‚Äôt want to waste. Black beans, just because. Used grape seed oil to cook them in cast iron on Med low heat. Thanks for sharing!
very good day of , can‚Äôt wait for leftovers since everything is always better day 2
followed recipe, it was way to full of spices. it drowns out any salmon flavor. will stick with my basic recipe. household agreed

It's a great, simple recipe! The second time I made this I added some chopped water chestnuts for a bit of a crunch which I thought was a nice addition. I also made a minor change by using a mixture of Italian bread crumbs and Panko crumbs.

Used fresh cooked salmon and less seasoning based on the reviews. Decreased Old Bay to 1 1/2 tsp., garlic powder to 1/2 tsp., no parsley, 1/2 tsp. pepper, 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire, and plain Panko breadcrumbs. Saut√©ed chopped onion, celery and yellow bell pepper (about 1/4 to 1/2 c. of each), cooled and added to the mix. It was so delicious! If I ever have leftover salmon I know what I‚Äôm making!
Simple and absolutely delicious
Tasty great !!! Next time I'll add my idea ..
Kids and adult approved. Make about once monthly. Kids often request because they like it so much. I make exactly how recipe says.
I made the patties according to the directions but cooked them in my air fryer. I served them with a yogurt dill sauce - they were scrumptious! I will definitely make this recipe again.
This recipe is excellent!!! I love these salmon patties so much I make them once a week. I make the recipe as written and I have had no problem.
I will surely make it again. Substituted seasoned bread crumbs for panko.

Love this. However, I don't like salmon so I appreciate how much this hides the salmon flavor. I made these with leftover salmon. So quick and easy. Big hit with all 3 teens, and my husband who doesn't usually like seafood cakes. I might use less worcestershire and salt next time. I didn't really measure the ingredients - just threw stuff in the bowl. I forgot the onion. I didn't use Old Bay, but looked online for a substitute, which included celery and a few other ingredients. I also didn't have dijon. As it was, it was extremely flavorful. Overall, a great recipe that will be made again and again. Thank you!
Yummy!

My husband wanted this because my MIL made it when he was a kid. However, this recipe is way more involved than what she made. I called her and she used inexpensive canned tuna, onion, egg, black pepper, and crushed saltine crackers - nothing else. I kept her on the phone as I tried her recipe and they really were actually much better and a lot easier to make.
We used fresh New Zealand salmon and served it with fresh dill sauce. We also used fresh dill instead of the parsley. It was spectacular!
Excellent recipe! Super fast and my husband loved it! My daughter even commented on how good these patties were.

This is the best Salmon Patties recipe I have ever tried! It was a hit with the whole family, even my picky 13 year old who is not a big seafood fan! Highly recommended! 
I did not put in the fresh parsley, but used dried instead.

I halved the recipe for 2 people and added all ingredients. The flavor was good, but even tho' I had a nice golden char on the outside, the inside was way too soft. In the past I have used left over baked salmon added to canned salmon and I like the texture much better.

Made this tonight with some leftover salmon filet and also a can to add more to it. Followed the directions exactly aside from not having Italian panko, and using just original. They were delicious! A definite keeper for salmon leftovers this summer. Thanks for the share!
I mixed up a dip made of 1/4 cup sour cream, a squirt of lemon juice and a handful of fresh dill weed. It complimented the spices in the salmon well.
This recipe was great. The family loves it for in the morning with some rich cheese grits or simply on it own. I definitely will be making more.
Too much going on in the seasoning department.
THIS WAS AWESOME
This may be a dup review. Too spicy and salty. Will stick with basic ingredients . Will not try again. Could not taste the fish. Thanks.
Way too much pepper called for in this recipe. I cut it to a third and found it more than adequate. Otherwise - they're good!
Very good simple tasty
Just Perfect.
We loved it. Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing!
Amazing recipe! I added crab claw meat to mine!
I added 2tbsp lemon juice
I ADD A LITTLE LEMON JUICE AND COLMANS HOT MUSTARD OR HOT SAUCE INSTEAD OF DIJON MUSTARD - VERY DELICIOUS
Very good followed the recipe to a T relly good.
Have made many salmon cakes and this is the best recipe I‚Äôve seen. Lots of flavor and they hold together nicely. Deleting all my other salmon cake recipes! So good!
I used canned Mackerel instead of the salmon. We loved it.

This was delicious. I didn't have panko bread crumbs so I used regular bread crumbs and I only used 1/2 cup. I substituted mayonnaise for the dressing. Otherwise, everything was the same. I made the patties smaller. Nice recipe and I'll definitely make these again!
